entry.title: open_type_math_support_fuzzer: ASSERT: Bad bounds passed to std::clamp
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5135696994959360
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: open_type_math_support_fuzzer Job Type: mac_libfuzzer_chrome_asan Platform Id: mac
Crash Type: ASSERT Crash Address: Crash State: Bad bounds passed to std::clamp libsystem_c.dylib blink::test::TestFontSelector::GetFontData
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=mac_libfuzzer_chrome_asan&range=1273612:1273644
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5135696994959360
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures with a test name like: ninja://chrome/test:interactive\\_ui\\_tests/%TranslateBubbleViewUITest.NetworkInterruption%
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit

entry.title: Disabling the feature CVDisplayLinkBeginFrameSource reduces requestAnimationFrame rate
entry.content:
Currently in stable there is a finch trial/experiment going on which affects the CVDisplayLinkBeginFrameSource feature. It affects the speed at which requestAnimationFrame runs.
- `--enable-features=CVDisplayLinkBeginFrameSource` causes requestAnimationFrame to run at 60Hz / 60 fps - `--disable-features=CVDisplayLinkBeginFrameSource` causes requestAnimationFrame to run at the display rate (120Hz in my case)
Sample test cases: - https://webglsamples.org/aquarium/aquarium.html - https://www.testufo.com/refreshrate

entry.title: Sites are auto-adjusting the mic input volume.
entry.content:
This template is intended to report audio/video communication bugs. These involve problems with microphones and/or webcams.
OS name: Windows OS version: Microphone model: Blue Yeti X Webcam model: Chrome version: Instructions to reproduce the problem:
Web apps that access the mic seem to be auto-adjusting the mic input volume in Windows regardless of mic settings or settings in the web app. Please see captured video for repro.
I am using a Blue Yeti X microphone with the Logitech G Hub software and have enabled the Blue Voice effects to tune my voice. My settings assume a that the system mic input volume is set to 100, because in the G Hub software I have my mic gain set to 20. I do this so that my levels are consistent across all apps. However, I have noticed that web sites/apps that use the mic constantly adjust the microphone input volume in Windows, which, when combined with G Hub, results in poor audio quality, specifically audio drop-offs. I have tried checking the audio settings in Edge/Chrome and resetting the microphone settings in Windows, but the issue persists. I have also set the microphone to not allow exclusive control and set the apps not to auto-adjust the volume, but this behavior still occurs in Edge.
The issue can be repro'd in any web site that uses the mic. I regularly use StreamYard, Teams, and Google Voice, regardless of any settings in Windows (e.g. "allow apps to take exclusive control") or the sites' settings themselves.
This seems to be an Edge/Chrome issue, as I do not experience this issue in Firefox. I assure you I have tried every Windows and G Hub setting I can, and every app OTHER than Edge/Chrome behaves exactly as I would expect. This ONLY happens with Edge/Chrome.

entry.title: [Crash] Make sure profile is not null
Force re-launch tryjob without uploading a whitespace patchset
entry.content: When developer wants to re-trigger the all the tryjobs for the same patchset, if it's still in the reuse window (currently 24 hours), LUCI CV will not any new tryjobs but happily reuse the previous green tryjobs. As a workaround, the developer would need to upload a new patchset with a whitespace change. It would be great if there's way for developers to tell LUCI CV not to reuse any tryjobs from previous run but launch new ones instead.

entry.title: Tests are failing: java.lang.AssertionError: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException: Pai...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): java.lang.AssertionError: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException: Paint Preview should have been shown, but never was.\nExpected: is <true>\n but: was <false>
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.paint_preview.StartupPaintPreviewHelperTest#testDisplayOnStartup
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/3a56c81758c47f0e3a8ee5056e654607
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Console logs from Shared Workers don't respect --enable-logging=stderr
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6410.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) OS: macOS Version 14.4.1 (Build 23E224)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) Launch Chrome with --enable-logging=stderr (2) Open https://gpuweb.github.io/cts/standalone/?worker=shared&runnow=1&q=webgpu:print_environment:info:
What is the expected result? The test uses console.log() to output some JSON. It should be printed to stderr, including this substring: "globalScope": "SharedWorkerGlobalScope",
What happens instead? It is not printed to stderr. You can see the shard logs here: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=68e26079f9240b10
Compare with main thread, dedicatedworker, and service worker, which all print to stderr. You can test these configs with: https://gpuweb.github.io/cts/standalone/?worker=0&runnow=1&q=webgpu:print_environment:info: https://gpuweb.github.io/cts/standalone/?worker=dedicated&runnow=1&q=webgpu:print_environment:info: https://gpuweb.github.io/cts/standalone/?worker=service&runnow=1&q=webgpu:print_environment:info: The message is also shown on the webpage, in addition to being console.log'd.
E.g. for service worker:
[14472:2144:0410/125028.949:INFO:CONSOLE(17)] "{ "globalScope": "ServiceWorkerGlobalScope", "globalTestConfig": { "enableDebugLogs": false, "maxSubcasesInFlight": 500, "noRaceWithRejectOnTimeout": false, "unrollConstEvalLoops": false, "compatibility": false, "forceFallbackAdapter": false, "logToWebSocket": false }, "baseResourcePath": "./resources/", "defaultRequestAdapterOptions": null, "adapterInfo": { "vendor": "nvidia", "architecture": "turing", "device": "0x2184", "description": "NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1660", "driver": "D3D12 driver version 27.21.14.5638", "backend": "D3D12", "type": "discrete GPU", "memoryHeaps": { "0": { "size": 6282018816, "properties": 1 }, "1": { "size": 17131386880, "properties": 30 } }, "d3dShaderModel": 64, "vkDriverVersion": null }, "userAgent": "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/125.0.0.0 Safari/537.36" }", source: http://127.0.0.1:52121/third_party/webgpu-cts/src/webgpu/print_environment.spec.js (17)
from this shard: https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=68e2607a051b9510
Why: We would like to see this in shard logs, to be able to verify issue 330596242 is fixed.

Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Add metrics tracking time for Print Backend calls
entry.content:
There is concern that maybe anti-virus software is impacting the cost of doing individual print query calls from the PrintBackend service instead of from the browser process. If true, this could be part of impact seen in the PrintPreview.InitialDisplayTime metric.
Instrument the query calls used by Print Preview that interact with PrintBackend. This is expected to isolate any possible impact from other variables, such as print job complexity or service startup costs.

entry.title: MediaStreamTrack WPT tests fail due to --disable-threaded-compositing flags
entry.content: When threaded compositing is disabled, it causes the MediaStreamTracks returned from getDisplayMedia() to issue 1-2 frames and then permanently mute. This results in failures for testing features like BrowserCaptureMediaStreamTrack.restrictTo.

entry.title: Restrict xHE-AAC support on Windows to non-N versions.
entry.content: Windows N doesn't have MediaFoundation support and partners have detected some mismatches in support when they try to use xHE-AAC. We should ensure we don't report support incorrectly.
